title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 August 2016 - XWiki

21:21 <iamchrisf> has quit  
21:26 <iamchrisf> has joined #xwiki  
21:35 \* mmercer spams xwikibot  
21:35 <vmassol> :)  
21:36 <mmercer> hey vmassol :)  
21:38 <vmassol> hi there  
21:38 <vmassol> how is your xwiki going?  
21:38 <vmassol> (still on holidays ATM, my last hours before going back to work tomorrow morning ;))  
21:39 <mmercer> eh, havent been able to do much,  changed jobs (thank god!)  new place uses confluence \*sniff\*  id so much rather play with python scripting in xwiki, lol  
21:39 <mmercer> i still have xwiki sandstorm integration on my agenda, just have to settle in to the new position a bit so that i can start recovering my time  
21:39 <vmassol> ok so an opportunity to convert them to xwiki then! :)  
21:40 <vmassol> ah yes would be nice to get this sandstorm integration done  
21:40 <vmassol> congrats for the new job  
21:40 <mmercer> tnx  
21:40 <mmercer> but you go enjoy your vaca  
21:40 <mmercer> ill be lurking again, now that im settling back in to a 'normal' life, lol  
21:40 <vmassol> now you'll be able to tell us what we should in XWiki to compete even better against confluence!  
21:40 <vmassol> \*should do  
21:41 <mmercer> i would \*love\* to see you guys build a cloud suite that can compete with confluence  
21:41 <mmercer> well, confluece / jira  
21:41 <vmassol> by cloud suite do you mean XWiki Cloud  
21:41 <vmassol> or do you mean a suite of different products?  
21:41 <mmercer> if you guys could get a top notch ticketing system to integrate with xwiki, that would be sooooo much more leverage to use  
21:41 <mmercer> suite of products  
21:41 <vmassol> ok  
21:42 <vmassol> indeed a ticketing system is something that's been itching me for a long time  
21:42 <vmassol> actually we have a s simple one  
21:42 <mmercer> xwiki as a standalone wiki is superb, but integrating it into other tools can be a bit less than stellar  
21:42 <vmassol> but it's not meant to compete with jira  
21:42 <vmassol> here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Task+Manager+Application  
21:43 <mmercer> yeah;  thats where you guys are losing out to atlassian the most though;  most enterprises use the atlassian 'suite' -- confluence, jira, bitbucket/stash, bamboo, etc  
21:43 <vmassol> "integrating it into other tools can be a bit less than stellar" the jira integration is not nice?  
21:43 <vmassol> well  
21:43 <vmassol> atlassian is mostly for devs  
21:43 <vmassol> our target is not devs  
21:43 <mmercer> very good point  
21:43 <vmassol> (I mean not specifically)  
21:43 <vmassol> we're targeting all parts of companies  
21:43 <mmercer> but but... its a better dev tool than the 'dev tool'  lol  
21:44 <vmassol> HR, etc  
21:44 <vmassol> hehe  
21:44 <mmercer> i \*hate\* that confluence has gone cloud only because the addon support has gone the way of the dodo now :\  
21:45 <vmassol> you do have lots of extensions for their cloud offer but they're quite expensive AFAICS  
21:45 <mmercer> well, they are also very restrictive on what can be used on the cloud platform  
21:45 <vmassol> ok  
21:45 <mmercer> in a 'standalone' environment, you dont have to worry as much about cross contamination of other topologies and products  
21:45 <vmassol> they're really cloud only now?  
21:45 <vmassol> (didn't know that)  
21:45 <vmassol> you can't download and install confluence in premises anymore?  
21:45 <mmercer> they have their on demand (cloud), and they do still have the on premise  
21:46 <vmassol> ok  
21:46 <vmassol> they're just pushing for cloud but still offering on prelises  
21:46 <mmercer> but its far less encountered now,  most companies dont want the burden of managing their own platform  
21:46 <vmassol> \*premises  
21:46 <mmercer> exactly  
21:47 <hakin> has joined #xwiki  
21:47 <vmassol> have you tried http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Task+Manager+Application ? (I haven't ;)). Don't know how good/bad it is. It's supposed to be a simple task maneger if you're need are small. For complex needs, the best is to use a product made for task mgmt (and integrate it with xwik, as we do with jira)  
21:47 <mmercer> not yet, ill take a look at it though  
21:47 <vmassol> s/you're/your  
21:48 <mmercer> but it looks like my team went to have lunch without me, haha  
21:48 <vmassol> ah sorry for holding you :)  
21:48 <mmercer> ill bb;  going to go join them in the cafeteria =D  
21:48 <vmassol> bon appetit  
21:48 <mmercer> nah,  i feel bad that youre in here instead of enjoying your last day of sanity :p  
21:48 <hakin> hello  
21:48 <vmassol> hehe  
21:48 <hakin> anyone knows what this error means [XWiki initialization] ERROR c.x.x.XWiki                    - Failed to initialize mandatory document  
21:48 <hakin> ?!  
21:48 <vmassol> watching the olympic games at the same time...  
21:49 <vmassol> hakin: hi, you need to proivide the root error  
21:49 <vmassol> or you can pastebing the whole error and I'll get it for you  
21:49 <vmassol> \*pastebin  
21:49 <vmassol> (it's the innermost error)  
21:49 <vmassol> (caused by...)  
21:49 <hakin> it's gigantic  
21:49 <hakin> but com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3202 in 3: Exception while reading document [xwiki:XWiki.WikiMacroParameterClass]  
21:50 <vmassol> don't paste here then ;)  
21:50 <hakin> Caused by: org.hibernate.HibernateException: Unable to get the default Bean Validation factory  
21:50 <hakin> sorry  
21:50 <vmassol> look at the root "cause byé  
21:50 <vmassol> "caused by"  
21:50 <vmassol> it's ok to paste 1 line  
21:50 <vmassol> just don't paste the full log :)  
21:50 <vmassol> lol  
21:50 <hakin> http://pastebin.com/NAdhzN4f  
21:50 <hakin> hehehehe  
21:51 <vmassol> so it seems you have a problem in your hibernate.cfg.xml file  
21:51 <hakin> what seems to be the problem ?!  
21:51 <vmassol> hibernate fails to initialize from reading the hibernate.cfg.xml file  
21:51 <vmassol> it doesn't say....  
21:52 <hakin> I'm using pgsql  
21:52 <vmassol> you should compare your version with the default version that comes with xwiki  
21:52 <hakin> the default use HSQl right !?  
21:52 <vmassol> correct  
21:52 <hakin> i commented and uncommented psql part  
21:52 <vmassol> you've probably made changes to it  
21:52 <vmassol> and made some mistales  
21:53 <vmassol> like forgetting to close comments  
21:53 <vmassol> or something like this  
21:53 <vmassol> \*mistakes  
21:53 <hakin> hummmm let me check  
21:54 <hakin> do you have an example to use with postgres ?!  
21:54 <vmassol> it's simple you just need to comment out hsqldb and uncomment pgsql :)  
21:55 <hakin> i did that ... :S  
21:55 <vmassol> sure  
21:55 <vmassol> just double check what youv' done  
21:56 <vmassol> you can paste your hibernate file if you want me to check it out  
21:56 <hakin> yeap ... just a sec  
21:58 <hakin> http://pastebin.com/zX6Rjsy4  
21:59 <hakin> and i'd downloaded the postgresql jar and put it on /WEB-INF/lib  
21:59 <iamchrisf> has quit  
21:59 <vmassol> looks good, have you made any change besides uncommenting/commenting sections?  
22:00 <hakin> nops  
22:00 <vmassol> which servlet container are you using?  
22:00 <hakin> tomcat  
22:00 <iamchrisf> has joined #xwiki  
22:00 <vmassol> Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.bval.jsr303.ApacheValidationProvider cannot be cast to javax.validation.spi.ValidationProvider  
22:00 <hakin> 8  
22:01 <vmassol> could suggest that the wrong jar is being used somerwhere  
22:01 <vmassol> googling this error...  
22:01 <hakin> hummmm could it be the postgresql jar ?!  
22:01 <hakin> so the hibernate error ?!  
22:03 <vmassol> interesting tool btw: http://jhades.org/ :)  
22:03 <vmassol> (it shows your exact problem btw)  
22:04 <vmassol> what is strange is that I've never seen this error reported when using tomcat 8  
22:05 <vmassol> can you make sure you haven't put any other lib in WEB-INF/lib  
22:05 <vmassol> ?  
22:05 <vmassol> (other than the postgresql driver jar)  
22:05 <hakin> just that one  
22:05 <vmassol> does it work if you use hsqldb?  
22:06 <vmassol> ie keep the postgresql jar but change your hibernate.cfg.xml to use hsqldb  
22:06 <hakin> I don't created a hsqldb file/db  
22:06 <hakin> ok ... let me try  
22:06 <vmassol> this is to diagnose the problem  
22:07 <vmassol> if it works it means the problem is not comging from the tomcat installation  
22:07 <vmassol> but from the postgresql jar  
22:08 <hakin> ok  
22:09 <vmassol> which version of Xwiki are you using btw?  
22:09 <hakin> just a sec  
22:09 <hakin> 8.2.1  
22:09 <vmassol> ok  
22:13 <hakin> vmassol same thing :S  
22:14 <vmassol> can you now remove the postgresql jar and try again?  
22:14 <hakin> yeap  
22:14 <vmassol> (still using hsqldb)  
22:14 <hakin> just a sec  
22:14 <hakin> ok  
22:15 <vmassol> (ofc make sure to restart tomcat every time)  
22:17 <vmassol> which precise version of tomcat are you using?  
22:18 <hakin> same error  
22:19 <hakin> 8.0.33  
22:19 <vmassol> ok should be good  
22:20 <vmassol> it's a standard tomcat install or you made some classloading config changes to it?  
22:20 <hakin> I change the datadir directory only... the rest is the default  
22:21 <vmassol> ok let me try to install xwiki 8.2.1 on tomcat 8.0.33  
22:21 <vmassol> using hsqldb  
22:21 <hakin> just a sec, let me try another thing  
22:21 <vmassol> ok  
22:21 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure it'll work if I do it though....  
22:21 <vmassol> as oterhwise we would have had reports already  
22:21 <vmassol> ....  
22:26 <iamchrisf> has quit  
22:27 <iamchrisf> has joined #xwiki  
22:32 <hakin> I think I get the problem  
22:32 <hakin> just let me try another thing  
22:32 <vmassol> cool!  
22:47 <hakin> vmssol  
22:47 <hakin> found out the problem  
22:47 <vmassol> cool what was it?  
22:48 <hakin> the lib bval-jsr303-0.5.jar doesn't work with xwiki  
22:48 <vmassol> where is this coming from?  
22:48 <hakin> I've other system that seems to use that lib  
22:48 <hakin> that jar was on my default lib  
22:49 <vmassol> it's in your tomcat setup somewhere?  
22:49 <vmassol> ok that makes sense  
22:49 <hakin> yeap  
22:49 <vmassol> precisely the issue is with hibernate (used by xwiki)  
22:53 <vmassol> glad you found the problem  
22:53 <hakin> yeap  
22:56 <hakin> thanks  
23:35 <vmassol> has quit  
23:40 <iamchrisf> hey all.  One of our admins deleted a user and it seems he owned some velocity script macros. As we are seeing “Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Click on this message for details.”  Having trouble rendering most of the pages.  Any help would be appreciated.  
23:40 <iamchrisf> Full stack trace: http://pastebin.com/raw/acJb12Q7  
23:52 <iamchrisf> has quit
